section.name: What is Fulcrum?
section.p: Fulcrum was originally created as part of the Turbine 3 effort. The idea was to be able to decouple the services from Turbine 2 allowing them to be used on both projects. Turbine 4 uses now (2017) more than 15 Fulcrum components.

Fulcrum has evolved into a component repository based on the Avalon framework. Each service is being converted into a stand alone component that can be released independently of the other components. This will allow the Turbine project to to release components as they change instead of having to release everything at once. This will also allow other projects to take advantage of these components.

section.name: Container compatibility
section.p: All components are compatible in Avalon's ECM container. Any dependencies on other components, system properties, or context elements are clearly documented in the docs for each component.

Additionally, Fulcrum offers the Yaafi component. Yaafi (Yet Another Avalon Framework Implementation) is a very simple container that is meant to be used with singleton components. It is perfect for unit testing your components. You can then run them in any other Avalon container like ECM, Phoenix, Excalibur, etc..

section.name: Where do I get releases?
section.p: Download the current main release sources and binaries through the Apache mirror system at the fulcrum download site.

section.name: How do I contribute, give feedback, fix bugs and so on?

ul.li: We have a Turbine mailing lists for discussion.
Create issues and comments in Apache JIRA system Turbine (Component Fulcrum)
You can also access the Turbine Fulcrum SVN repository
You can access the Turbine Fulcrum sub project Git (read only) repository
